messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
What's the temperature in Grand Canyon in Fahrenheit

The Grand Canyon covers a huge area (North Rim, South Rim, Inner Gorge, etc.) and temperatures vary widely by location and season. Could you tell me:

1. Which part of the Canyon you mean (e.g. South Rim, North Rim, Phantom Ranch)?  
2. Are you looking for the current temperature, a forecast for a specific date, or long-term averages?

With those details I can give you a more precise temperature answer (or point you to a reliable forecast source).
I don’t know exactly. Could you check it for me?

Grand Canyon National Park covers over a million acres—from the South Rim to the North Rim down into the Inner Gorge—so temperatures can vary by tens of degrees. To get you an accurate reading, could you let me know:

1. Which location you’d like (e.g. South Rim Visitor Center, North Rim, Phantom Ranch, etc.)  
2. Whether you want the current temperature, a forecast for a specific date/time, or a historical average.

If you’re not sure, the South Rim Visitor Center is the most commonly referenced spot—just let me know if that works for you.
I’m not sure about the location. Could we just use the South Rim Visitor Center?

I don’t have direct access to live weather feeds, but you can get the current temperature at the South Rim Visitor Center of Grand Canyon National Park by checking one of these reliable sources:  
• National Weather Service (weather.gov) – enter “Grand Canyon South Rim”  
• Weather.com or AccuWeather – search “Grand Canyon South Rim Visitor Center”  
• A weather-app on your phone or smart speaker – ask “What’s the temperature at Grand Canyon South Rim Visitor Center?”

If you need me to walk you through any of those sites or apps, just let me know!
Alright, I'll check those out. Thanks!
You’re welcome! If you have any other questions—about the park, getting there, hiking tips, or anything else—just let me know. Enjoy your trip!
